## Course Information
Credit Hours: 3

Schedule: Tuesday and Thursday, 11:30-12:45

Prerequisites: Math 671

Required textbooks/materials: No official text, but *Abstract Algebra*, by Dummit and Foote may be a useful resource.

Course Description:  We will concentrate on theory of rings, modules, and fields this semester. Topics include field theory, ideal theory, factorization, localization, and constructions in the category of rings.

<!-- ## Student Learning Objectives-->

## Grading 

Students will submit weekly homework via Brightspace. It can be handwritten and scanned, but typed is preferred. We will have two in-class proctored midterm exams and a final exam.
Grade weighting are: Homework: 40%. Exams: 20%, 20%, and 20%. Final grades will be assigned as follows: 90-100: 4.0, 87-89: 3.7, 83-86: 3.3, 80-82: 3.0, 77-79: 2.7, 73-76: 2.3, 70-72: 2.0, 67-69: 1.7, 63-66: 1.3, 60-62: 1.0, 0-59: 0.0. No grades will be dropped.
